author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Tamil Nadu Foodgrains Merchants Association has appealed to the State government to postpone the implementation of Total Solution Project (TSP) by the Department of Commercial Taxes Department since the Central government is planning to implement the Goods and Service Tax in the near future.

In a memorandum submitted to the Finance Minister, O, Panneerselvam, the president of the association, S. P. Jeyapragasam, listed the shortcomings in TSP and said that its implementation in the present form would affect small and medium traders and manufacturers.

The association pointed out that when Value Added Tax was introduced in 2003 training classes for the authorities and awareness programmes for stakeholders were conducted.

But the TSP had been implemented from January 29 without any training to the authorities or awareness programmes for stakeholders.

Appeal

It appealed to the government to implement TSP after training the authorities and conducting awareness programmes for stakeholders.

A committee comprising officials, stakeholders and legal experts should be formed to remove the shortcomings in TSP.

“Its implementation in the present form would affect small and medium traders and manufacturers”
title: Plea to postpone implementation of TSP
